name: audio circuit machinespec biblispec appendum
status: A living document of carved wood and soldered circuits

yidaki.name: Yidaki (Didgeridoo)
yidaki.description: Woodwind instrument producing low-frequency drones for songlines and ceremonies; pitch modulated by breath and tongue.
yidaki.notes: Tied to Yolŋu manikay and wangga; non-electronic precursor to oscillator-based sound.

ipu.name: Ipu (Hawaiian Gourd Drum)
ipu.description: Double-gourd drum struck or shaken for mele and hula; produces resonant, rhythmic pulses.
ipu.notes: Accompanies pentatonic chants; organic analog to mechanical rhythm generators.

pate.name: Pate (Tuvaluan Log Drum)
pate.description: Log drum with variable pitches for fatele dance-songs; struck with sticks for communal rhythms.
pate.notes: Similar to Micronesian slit drums; non-electronic rhythm source.

pūtātara.name: Pūtātara (Māori Conch Horn)
pūtātara.description: Conch horn producing resonant, single-tone calls for ceremonial or signaling purposes; used in haka and karanga.
pūtātara.notes: Tied to Māori whakapapa and environmental stewardship

kundu.name: Kundu (Melanesian Hourglass Drum)
kundu.description: Hourglass-shaped drum with skin head, struck for ceremonial dances and storytelling; produces varied timbres.
kundu.notes: Used in Tolai (Kuanua) rituals; reflects land-ocean balance, disrupted by environmental changes like invasive species in coastal ecosystems.

moog-ladder-filter.name: Moog Ladder Filter
moog-ladder-filter.description: Four-pole lowpass filter with resonance control.

stylophone.name: Stylophone Reed Oscillator
stylophone.description: Pocket electronic organ using physical metal reeds contacted by stylus

crystal-radio.name: Crystal Radio Detector
crystal-radio.description: Passive AM radio receiver using mineral crystal rectification.

ring-modulator.name: Ring Modulator
ring-modulator.description: Amplitude modulator creating metallic 'robot voice' effects; used in sci-fi films and experimental music.

buchla-lowpass-gate.name: Buchla Lowpass Gate
buchla-lowpass-gate.description: Combined VCA and filter using light-dependent resistor; creates organic 'breathing' envelope effects.

tape-echo.name: Tape Echo/Delay
tape-echo.description: Mechanical delay using continuous tape loop with multiple playback heads; created iconic slapback echo.

stepped-tone-generator.name: Stepped Tone Generator
stepped-tone-generator.description: Dual-555 stepped tone generator producing video game-like sound effects.
stepped-tone-generator.notes: Later dubbed 'Atari Punk Console' by DIY electronics community.

theremin.name: Theremin
theremin.description: Gesture-controlled electronic instrument using heterodyning for pitch/volume; earliest fully electronic sound generator.
theremin.notes: Pioneered capacitive sensing for sound modulation.

tonewheel-organ.name: Hammond Tonewheel Organ
tonewheel-organ.description: Electromechanical organ generating tones via spinning wheels and pickups; precursor to additive synthesis.
tonewheel-organ.notes: Used in early arcades and influenced sampled sound tech.

novachord.name: Novachord
novachord.description: First polyphonic synthesizer with vibrato and filters; vacuum-tube based tone shaping.
novachord.notes: Produced only ~1,000 units; used in film scores.

clavioline.name: Clavioline
clavioline.description: Portable monophonic keyboard synth with vibrato effects; attached to pianos for electronic tones.
clavioline.notes: Featured in hits like 'Telstar' (1962); transistor versions followed.

transistor-amp.name: Darlington Transistor Amplifier
transistor-amp.description: Early transistor-based audio amplifier using paired transistors for high gain; replaced vacuum tubes in portable audio.
transistor-amp.notes: Patented at Bell Labs; enabled compact, low-power audio in games.

pinball.name: Pinball Chime Circuit
pinball.description: Electro-mechanical chime and bell system driven by transistor switches and RC timing networks in pinball machines.

defender.name: Defender Audio Board
defender.description: Hybrid board for effects and speech; foundational for early Williams arcades.
defender.notes: Shared architecture in 1980s games but evolved later (e.g., YM2151 in 1990s).

light-theremin.name: Light-Controlled Theremin
light-theremin.description: Pitch modulated by ambient light. From 'Getting Started in Electronics' (1983).

led-organ.name: LED Photophonic Organ
led-organ.description: Optical keyboard using LED-to-LDR pairs for note generation.

white-noise.name: White Noise Generator
white-noise.description: Broadband noise output for audio testing.
